articles.content:
Delegation of Korean social scientists society leaves for Sri Lanka 
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean social scientists society led by its chairman Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left here yesterday to participate in the world conference on the cause of independence in the 21st century slated to be held in Colombo.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Thae Hyong Chol, president of the Academy of Social Sciences, and officials concerned and Chinese ambassador  to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

articles.content:
Greetings to governor-general of the Bahamas 
    Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on June 12 sent a message of greetings to Deim Ivy Dumont upon his appointment as governor-general of the Bahamas.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, the message wished the governor-general success in his responsible work.

articles.content:
Russian political party participates in international signature campaign
     Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The party for peace and unity of Russia participated in the international signature campaign for supporting the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and demanding the immediate pullout of the U.S. troops from South Korea.
 Its chairwoman Sazhi Umalatova signed a signature paper on behalf of 36,000 party members.
